titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Robert M. Martin, Indictment
CWG7398

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } November Term 1865
Robert M Martin

The Grand Jury of Muhlenberg County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Robert M. Martin of the crime of Robbery Committed as follows, viz: The said Robert M. Martin on the 3rd day of December 1863 in the County aforesaid -- willfully and feloniously took Five Overcoats the property of F. B. Hancock and E R Weir Jr from the immediate presence and possession of James A Campbell the agent and clerk for said Hancock & Weir and by putting him said James A. Campbell in fear of some immediate injury to his person from violence and force of arms, and against the peace and dignty of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Henry Porter
Foreman Grand Jury.
E. P. Campbell
Attorney for the Commonwealth.

Information
given by
James A. Campbell
G. B. Eades
F. B. Hancock.

Upon the Indictment aforesaid is the following "A True bill Henry Porter foreman Grand Jury. Filed in open Court Nov 20th 1865 Att. T. J Jones D. C."
"Bench Warrant to Issue & bail fixed at $500.

R. T. Petree Cir Judge
A Copy
Attest
J. H. Reno C, M, C, C,
By Tho, J, Jones D, C,

Muhlenberg Cir Ct
Comlth
vs. } Copy of Indictment Robbery
Robert M. Martin
